etymologies: late 17th century: from Japanese mogusa, from moe kusa ‘burning herb’

definitions: a downy substance obtained from the dried leaves of an Asian plant related to mugwort. It is burned on or near the skin in Eastern medicine as a counterirritant.

notes.text: The plant is Crossostephium artemisioides, family Compositae

shortDefinitions: downy substance obtained from dried leaves of Asian plant related to mugwort
